articles.title: It’s Called ‘Plant-Based,’ Look It Up
articles.description: There’s a difference between disavowing all animal byproducts and simply trying to eat less meat.
articles.content:
Plant-based items such as jerky, ice cream and protein bars are becoming increasingly common on supermarket shelves. Fast-food chains including Dunkin Donuts and Burger King have even started offering plant-based menu options such as the Impossible Whopper.

articles.description: Your lease probably includes a clause prohibiting alterations. But do not despair.

articles.author: Christian L. Wright
articles.title: 5 New Standout Safari Camps
articles.description: These lodges help prove that safari camps can be leaders in conservation, sustainability, design, eco-sensitivity and hospitality.
articles.content: Behind the scenes, Mombo is now 100 percent solar powered, with sophisticated sewage and water filtration systems. More obvious is the English oak, from managed forests in Croatia, used for guest-room floors; Iroko hardwood from West Africa for doors and wind… [+691 chars]

articles.author: Amy Qin
articles.title: ‘Block the Impact of Religion’: China Sends Muslim Children to Boarding Schools
articles.description: China has separated nearly half a million children from their families in Xinjiang, aiming to instill loyalty to party and country.
articles.content: Beijing has sought for decades to suppress Uighur resistance to Chinese rule in Xinjiang, in part by using schools in the region to indoctrinate Uighur children. Until recently, though, the government had allowed most classes to be taught in the Uighur langua… [+1434 chars]

articles.title: In a New Country, a Single Mother Sharpens Her Business Skills - The New York Times

The path to resettlement was overwhelming.

articles.title: Somalia Bombing Kills Dozens Near Mogadishu
articles.description: Officials said a truck filled with explosives blew up at a busy intersection outside the capital. Shabab militants are suspected in the attack.
